abstract: Heating and air-conditioning unit comes untethered from crane in Midtown Manhattan, lightly injuring seven people after it crashes thirty stories to the ground; observers say incident could have been far worse had it occurred amid weekday foot traffic.
lead_paragraph: The crane was lifting a heating and air-conditioning unit to the top of 261 Madison Avenue when it came untethered, sending the unit falling 30 stories to the ground, the Fire Department said.

headline.main: Crane Accident in Midtown Manhattan Injures 7 and Damages Buildings
headline.print_headline: Crane Collapse Causes Heavy Equipment to Fall, Injuring 7 in Midtown Manhattan

snippet: The crane was lifting a heating and air-conditioning unit to the top of 261 Madison Avenue when it came untethered, sending the unit falling 30 stories to the ground, the Fire Department said.
